intro: Malleola mimus, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Malleola mimus is typically found in rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
